issue.title: React 18  - Chakra UI v2
issue.body:
We are starting the development of Chakra UI v2 🎉 

The scope of this upcoming major release is to support React 18 and remove long known deprecations. We keep the scope as narrow as possible to provide feature-scoped major releases to all our users and a smooth upgrade experience.

We switched our default branch from `main` to `next`. This allows us to publish the pre-release version á la `@chakra-ui/react@2.0.0-next.X`. The first next release was published moments ago. 

With this in place, we can test the React 18 support in our applications and resolve upcoming issues until we are confident to release Chakra UI v2.

If you experience any React 18 related issues or tips we should know about, feel free to comment below and we'll look into it.

**Upgrade guide**

1. Update `react`, `react-dom` and their respective `@types/` package to version 18
2. Upgrade to the `next` pre-release
3. Test and report any issues you have below.

> Join our Discord Server for React 18 issues: https://discord.gg/kfp3UQh4Y2

issue.title: compiling error: Can't import the named export 'AnimatePresence' from non EcmaScript module
issue.body: ### Description when i try to run the demo of the get start page step by step, i get this error tips: ---------- Failed to compile. ./node_modules/@chakra-ui/react/node_modules/@chakra-ui/transition/dist/chunk-3TED3OTR.mjs Can't import the named export 'AnimatePresence' from non EcmaScript module (only default export is available) ---------- the version of the related packages: ` "@chakra-ui/react": "^2.5.1", "@chakra-ui/theme": "^2.2.4", ... "react": "^16.13.1", ` this happen just when i want to import { ChakraProvider } from '@chakra-ui/react' or import { ChakraBaseProvider } from '@chakra-ui/react' ### Link to Reproduction https://chakra-ui.com/getting-started/cra-guide#2-provider-setup ### Steps to reproduce 1. Go to '...' 2. Click on '...' 3. Scroll down to '...' 4. See error ### Chakra UI Version 2.5.1 ### Browser * ### Operating System - [X] macOS - [ ] Windows - [ ] Linux ### Additional Information

issue.title: Icon does not change its size using iconSize in Checkbox with default size values
issue.body:
### Description

This issue is based on #6288, with a more detailed description of the problem because it was **not resolved**.

When the `iconSize` parameter is set in the `<Checkbox>` component, the icon size does not change.

The size also does not change when specifying other standard values for the `size` parameter, namely `sm`, `md`, and `lg`.

Example:

```tsx
<Checkbox iconSize="2rem">Option</Checkbox>
```

Or an example from the [DOCUMENTATION](https://chakra-ui.com/docs/components/checkbox/usage#changing-the-icon-color-and-size):

```tsx
<Checkbox
  iconColor="blue.400"
  iconSize="1rem"
>
  Option
</Checkbox>
```

However, miraculously, when the `size` parameter is set to a value different from the standard ones, `iconSize` starts working

Example:

```tsx
<Checkbox
  size="other"
  iconSize="2rem"
>
  Option
</Checkbox>
```

### Link to Reproduction

https://codesandbox.io/s/chakra-ui-checkbox-iconsize-problem-again-8zl7jx?file=/src/App.js

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to 'CodeSandbox link'
2. Look at the 'Checkbox Example'
3. Examine the 'iconSize' parameter
4. See it doesn't work

### Chakra UI Version

2.2.1

### Browser

Google Chrome 118

### Operating System

- [ ] macOS
- [ ] Windows
- [X] Linux

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: When printing a page with responsive layout, the browser always use the narrowest breakpoint.
issue.body:
### Description

Minimum code:

```
function App() {
  return (
    <Flex>
      <Button display={["none", "none", "none", "none", "block"]}>A</Button>
      <Button display={["none", "none", "none", "block", "block"]}>B</Button>
      <Button display={["none", "none", "block", "block", "block"]}>C</Button>
      <Button display={["none", "block", "block", "block", "block"]}>D</Button>
      <Button display={["block", "block", "block", "block", "block"]}>E</Button>
    </Flex>
  );
}
```

When trying to print the page in the browser, there's always only button E visible, no matter how wide the page is.

### Link to Reproduction

https://codesandbox.io/s/trusting-bassi-mrr2st?file=/src/index.js

### Steps to reproduce

Open the page in the browser and open the print dialog.

### Chakra UI Version

2.8.1

### Browser

Edge & Safari. Not tested with other browsers.

### Operating System

- [X] macOS
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux

### Additional Information

_No response_
